com.intel.idrml.iagent.framework

Class IAgentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.idrml.iagent.framework.IAgentManager

  • public class IAgentManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The IAgentManager class is a collection of methods to access all resources on the gateway managed by iAgent.

    This is the major access entry for all resources under iAgent. In any APP, IAgentManager.getInstance() shall be called firstly to get the singleton instance. Any action to create a new instance by "new" is NOT allowed.

    Please note the API name convention that any API with prefix “Do” in the name will trigger the message interaction with iAgent process. For example API DoDeviceQuery() API will query the devices and associated resources from iAgent according to the query parameters, and the API DoResourceGET() will trigger iAgent to send GET request to the final service provider and return the result to the caller.

    The SDK will cache all the devices and resource queried from API DoDeviceQuery(). The APIs getAllDevices() , getDevice() and getReource() can be used to find the device and resources cached from previous query result. It helps the user application avoid frequently calling DoDeviceQuery() for retrieve the devices. The results of two DoDeviceQuery() calls will be overlapped, rather than being overwritten.

    Please note the SDK won’t update the online status or resources of a cached device if the device was actually going offline or had resource changes. To monitor the status change of device and resource, the API addRDMonitor() is available for this purpose. Your application can use the RDQueryParam to specify the monitoring condition. The API addRDMonitor() can be called multiple times, and the devices reported by the monitors are also cached in the application locally.

    To get the data of resources managed by the iAgent, the application can use one-time call DoResourceGET(), or use the data monitor API addDataMonitor() for automatically data reporting. The listener API for the data monitor is:
    onResourceDataChanged(java.lang.String deviceID, java.lang.String resouceUri, ResourceDataGeneral data)
    The content of reported date is provided by the parameter of class ResourceDataGeneral object in the callback API. As the data reporting was actually implemented in a COAP message from iAgent to the user application, the COAP payload is parsed and converted to a object of class ResourceDataGeneral or its extended subclasses. The SDK already implemented two data parsers for LWM2M and OCF payload format, which output the instance of ResourceDataLWM2M and ResourceDataOCF (subclass of ResourceDataGeneral) respectively. The SDK provides a mechanism for adding user defined payload parser through calling API addPayloadParser().

    Since:
    Dec 2016

      • addRDMonitor

        public java.lang.String addRDMonitor(RDQueryParam query,
                                     OnRDEventListener onRDEventListener)
                              throws CoapException
        Method to add a monitor for property change of devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous, that means this method maybe blocked for network issue, but there is a 2s timer for timeout. Property change event will be notified by the second parameter onRDEventListener.
        Parameters:
        query - This parameter is for different query condition of target device, group or resource.
        onRDEventListener - This parameter is event handler when attribute value for monitored target is changed.
        Returns:
        ID of this monitor, which shall be stored by APP and used when this RD monitor to deleted.
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

      • modifyRDMonitor

        public java.lang.String modifyRDMonitor(java.lang.String mid,
                                        RDQueryParam query,
                                        OnRDEventListener onRDEventListener)
                                 throws CoapException
        Method to modify a monitor for property change of devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous, that means this method maybe blocked for network issue, but there is a 2s timer for timeout.
        Parameters:
        mid - ID of this monitor, which is from returned value of API addRDMonitor.
        query - This parameter is for different query condition of target device, group or resource.
        onRDEventListener - This parameter is event handler when attribute value for monitored target is changed.
        Returns:
        ID of this monitor, which shall be stored by APP and used when this RD monitor to deleted.
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

      • removeRDMonitor

        public boolean removeRDMonitor(java.lang.String rdMoniterID)
                        throws CoapException
        Method to delete a monitor for property change of devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous, that means this method maybe blocked for network issue, but there is a 2s timer for timeout.
        Parameters:
        rdMoniterID - ID of this monitor, which is from returned value of API addRDMonitor.
        Returns:
        true - Success false - Fail
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

      • addDataMonitor

        public java.lang.String addDataMonitor(DataQueryParam query,
                                       OnDataListener eventHandler)
                                throws CoapException
        Method to add a monitor for value change of attribute in devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous, that means this method maybe blocked for network issue, but there is a 2s timer for timeout. Value change event will be notified by the second parameter eventHandler.
        Parameters:
        query - This parameter is for different query condition of target attribute.
        eventHandler - This parameter is event handler when attribute value for monitored target is changed.
        Returns:
        ID of this monitor, which shall be stored by APP and used when this RD monitor to deleted.
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

      • removeDataMonitor

        public boolean removeDataMonitor(java.lang.String dataMonitorID)
                          throws CoapException
        Method to delete a monitor for value change of attribute in devices, groups or resources. This method is synchronous, that means this method maybe blocked for network issue, but there is a 2s timer for timeout. Value change event will be notified by the second parameter eventHandler.
        Parameters:
        dataMonitorID - ID of this monitor, which is from returned value of API addDataMonitor.
        Returns:
        true - Success false - Fail
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server

      • DoResourceGET

        public ResourceDataGeneral DoResourceGET(Resource resource)
                                  throws CoapException
        Method to get attribute value of resource in devices, groups. This method is synchronous and the timer for timeout is a 2s. Returned value is string in JSON format, which means APP itself need to parse the returned JSON string according to such different devices as LWM2M, OIC, MODBUS and son.
        Parameters:
        resource - This parameter is the target resource object.
        Returns:
        String of attributes value in JSON format.
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

                                                 java.lang.String property)
                                          throws CoapException
        Throws:
        CoapException

      • DoResourceGET

        public ResourceDataGeneral DoResourceGET(java.lang.String resourceUrl)
                                  throws CoapException
        Method to get attribute value of resource in devices, groups. This method is synchronous and the timer for timeout is a 2s. Returned value is string in JSON format, which means APP itself need to parse the returned JSON string according to such different devices as LWM2M, OIC, MODBUS and son.
        Parameters:
        resourceUrl - This parameter is URL for the target resource object.
        Returns:
        String of attributes value in JSON format.
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam, OnDataListener

      • DoResourcePUT

        public boolean DoResourcePUT(Resource resource,
                             int format,
                             java.lang.String payload)
                      throws CoapException
        Method to change attribute value of resource in devices, groups. This method is synchronous and the timer for timeout is a 2s. APP itself need to compose the request payload string in JSON format according to such different devices as LWM2M, OIC, MODBUS and son.
        Parameters:
        resource - This parameter is the target resource object.
        format - This parameter is media format, which defined in MediaTypeFormat.
        payload - This parameter is the request message with different content format for different devices.
        Returns:
        true - Success false - Fail
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        Resource, MediaTypeFormat

      • DoResourcePropertyPUT

        public boolean DoResourcePropertyPUT(Resource resource,
                                     int format,
                                     ResourcePropertyData proprty)
                              throws CoapException
        Throws:
        CoapException

                              throws CoapException
        Throws:
        CoapException

      • DoResourcePUT

        public boolean DoResourcePUT(java.lang.String resourceUrl,
                             int format,
                             java.lang.String payload)
                      throws CoapException
        Method to change attribute value of resource in devices, groups. This method is synchronous and the timer for timeout is a 2s. APP itself need to compose the request payload string in JSON format according to such different devices as LWM2M, OIC, MODBUS and son.
        Parameters:
        resourceUrl - This parameter is URL of the target resource object.
        format - This parameter is media format, which defined in MediaTypeFormat.
        payload - This parameter is the request message with different content format for different devices.
        Returns:
        true - Success false - Fail
        Throws:
        CoapException - exception will be thrown when no response or invalid response code from server
        See Also:
        Resource, MediaTypeFormat

      • addPayloadParser

        public void addPayloadParser(int formatType,
                             PayloadParser parser)
        Method to register the parser for resource property on special device.
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format of resource property on special device, which shall not duplicate with the result of API getFormatSupported. This formatType can be self-defined.
        parser - This parameter is the parser implementation for resource property on special device.
        See Also:
        PayloadParser

      • getFormatSupported

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getFormatSupported()
        Method to register the parser for resource property on special device.
        Returns:
        all format types of resource property that are supported on this gateway.

      • DoDeviceQuery

        public java.util.List<DeviceInfo> DoDeviceQuery(RDQueryParam query)
        Method to get devices that is specified by parameter query.
        Parameters:
        query - This parameter is for different query condition of target devices.
        Returns:
        The specified device by parameter query if existing on the gateway or NULL if not existing.
        See Also:
        RDQueryParam
